metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6313 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
The mixing functions in the random number generator in Libgcrypt before1.5.6, 1.6.x before 1.6.6, and 1.7.x before 1.7.3 and GnuPG before 1.4.21make it easier for attackers to obtain the values of 160 bits by leveragingknowledge of the previous 4640 bits.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgcrypt11 - 1.5.3-2ubuntu4.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

gnupg - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.4
gnupg-curl - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.4
gpgv - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libgcrypt11 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.3-2ubuntu4.4').
libgcrypt20: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
gnupg package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.16-1ubuntu2.4').
